admission_text:
Planning your visit to the Museum of Art & Archaeology's newly renovated galleries? The new location gives students and the entire Columbia community a way to explore six continents and six millennia — all without leaving mid-Missouri through galleries which include permanent and rotating exhibits from ancient artifacts to contemporary art. 

**Location & Hours Group Visits**

### 1\. When and Where

##### Hours

  * 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Tuesday through Friday
  * noon to 4 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays
  * closed on all University observed holidays

##### Address

The museum in the east wing of Ellis Library (across from Memorial Union) on the ground floor. There are two outside entrances - one off of Lowry Mall, and an accessible entrance off of Hitt Street. 

##### Parking and driving

[Metered parking](https://parking.missouri.edu/locations/metered-parking/https://parking.missouri.edu/locations/metered-parking/) is available nearby in the [Hitt Street visitor lot](https://muop-mapapp.umad.umsystem.edu/muparking/index.html?lot=6379) and several other locations around campus. [Hitt Street Garage](https://map.missouri.edu/index.html?bldg=37279) is up the road and always free on weekends. 

Between 8:15 a.m. and 3:45 p.m., when school is in session, several sections of campus streets are closed — including the section of Hitt Street in front of the museum.

### **2\. Always Free**

The Museum is open to the community and admission is always free. However, you might want to bring mo...

# Visit us

Arrive curious. Leave inspired.

[Plan your visit](https://maa.missouri.edu/visit-tours)

## Discover the Collection

The Museum's collections include more than 16,000 objects from six continents and span five millennia – from prehistory to the present.

[Collections](https://maa.missouri.edu/collections)

Sign up for the Museum of Art and Archaeology's newsletter to receive information about exhibitions and special events. 

[Sign up](https://missouri.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_2iflFgjsIQG9CbY)

Visit our art vending machine, Art-o-Mat, to purchase original works of art including paintings, sculptures, jewelry, and mixed media objects. Tokens available in the Museum Store. 

[More info](https://maa.missouri.edu/news/perfectly-pocket-sized)
